paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 73-year-old White female underwent carpal tunnel release surgery; Congo red staining of removed tenosynovial tissue was amyloid (+), typed as ATTR by mass spectrometry.

functional_data.summary: The patient remained asymptomatic, with minimal to no change on echo and NT-proBNP, but she developed grade 3 diffuse uptake on 99mTc-PYP scan.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was found in a patient with cardiac involvement.
variants.population_frequency: 3% to 4% of African Americans are heterozygote carriers.
variants.source_location: Part IV: Opportunities for Earlier Identification of Cardiac Amyloidosis
variants.additional_notes: The patient was started on tafamidis after shared decision making.
key_quotes: Congo red staining of removed tenosynovial tissue was amyloid (+), typed as ATTR by mass spectrometry.
At 4-year follow-up (age 77), the patient remained asymptomatic, with minimal to no change on echo and NT-proBNP, but she developed grade 3 diffuse uptake on 99mTc-PYP scan.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was clear and well-defined in the text.
